definition: to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: With the countless torches lit, with the silent sea of faces and the unbarred heads.
sentences.chinese: 无数火炬燃起，无数脸孔和致哀者汇集的沉默海洋。

sentences.english: They have also compiled algorithmic laws of growth for hundreds of seashells and butterflies .
sentences.chinese: 他们还汇集了上百种海贝和蝴蝶的生长算法法则。

sentences.english: This is review of useful design trends in modern Web applications.
sentences.chinese: 这里汇集现代Web应用程序设计的实用技巧。

sentences.english: Rainwater on the mountain flows into the valley.
sentences.chinese: 山上的雨水全都汇集流进了山洼里。

sentences.english: Gilardi concurs that the newly compiled data is a powerful tool.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉迪认同新汇集的数据是一个强有力的工具。

sentences.english: The Fed is the focal point for domestic US funds movement.
sentences.chinese: 联邦储备系统是美国国内资金转移的汇集点。

sentences.english: As the aluminum began to melt, it pooled off and ran off onto the roadway surface.
sentences.chinese: 铝开始熔化成液体，然后汇集成流，在路面上流淌。

sentences.english: Melville incorporated in "Moby Dick" an exhaustive encyclopaedia of whaling lore .
sentences.chinese: 梅尔维尔在《白鲸》中汇集了各种捕鲸知识。

sentences.english: She amassed her papers for her memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 她把文件汇集起来准备写回忆录。

sentences.english: The Asian Games take place every four years and involve athletes from all over Asia.
sentences.chinese: 亚运会每四年举行一次，汇集了来自亚洲的运动员。

sentences.english: This results in blood pooling in the lower legs.
sentences.chinese: 这导致血液在下肢汇集。

sentences.english: The shopping and dining areas are home to numerous world-famous brands and chefs.
sentences.chinese: 购物餐饮区域汇集了为数众多的世界级品牌和厨师。

sentences.english: He collects specializing in various rabbit-hole story.
sentences.chinese: 他乐衷于汇集各类光怪陆离的故事。

sentences.english: This hall regroups all software and computer related companies only.
sentences.chinese: 这个展厅汇集了软件和电脑相关产品的公司。

sentences.english: like a melange of all different sort of things.
sentences.chinese: 像一个汇集了各种事物的大杂烩。

sentences.english: I'm going to gather some materials about Picasso.
sentences.chinese: 我筹算汇集一些涉及毕加索的质料。

definition: to come together (to form sth)/to assemble together/(chemistry) to polymerize
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
collecting together (of distinguished people or exquisite objects)/to gather/to assemble
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
variant of 交匯|交汇/to flow together/confluence (of rivers, airflow, roads)/(international) cooperation
to flow together/confluence (of rivers, airflow, roads)/(international) cooperation
